description: Displays box plots for the top 10 taxa (by mean relative abundance) at any taxomonmic level.  Stacked bar charts and single taxon views with statistics are also available.
title: Relative Abundance

description: Calculates Shannon, Simpson, Chao1 and ACE diversity metrics for each sample, then displays as a box plot.  For longitudinal data, users can fit a curve to a dot plot of alpha diversity.
title: Alpha Diversity

description: Calculates beta diversity using Bray-Curtis, Jensen-Shannon divergence, and Jaccard distance metrics, and more.  Points are displayed on a 2D ordination plot where point color and shape can be mapped to available metadata.
title: Beta Diversity

description: Uses DESeq2 to identify differentially abundant taxa, at any taxonomic level, for a user-selected pairwise comparison.  Results are displayed as a bubble chart that incorporates statistics.
title: Differential Abundance

description: Calculates Spearman correlation between continuous covariates (e.g. age, weight, etc) from a selected set of samples and either taxa or other study variables.
title: Correlation
